labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to interact with Microsoft PowerPlatform and Dataverse, providing tools for retrieving entity metadata, querying records, and exploring relationships within the platform. The core functionality revolves around data access, retrieval, and visualization, with intelligence features to assist in development and querying tasks. The tools enable developers and users to build queries, understand data structures, and navigate relationships, making it a powerful tool for working with PowerPlatform data.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Database Operations" was chosen because the server's main functionality revolves around querying, retrieving, and managing data within the PowerPlatform/Dataverse environment. This is highly aligned with database operations. The secondary label "Development Tools" is appropriate since the server enhances the development experience with context-aware prompts and AI-driven insights. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: PowerPlatform MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @michsob/powerplatform-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Access and explore PowerPlatform/Dataverse entities with intelligent assistance. Retrieve metadata, build queries, and visualize relationships effortlessly. Enhance your development experience with context-aware prompts and AI-driven insights.

tools.name: get-entity-metadata
tools.description: Deploy Server PowerPlatform MCP Server Claim Server @michsob/powerplatform-mcp Try in Playground get-entity-metadata

tools.name: get-entity-attributes
tools.description: Get attributes/fields of a PowerPlatform entity

tools.name: get-entity-attribute
tools.description: Get a specific attribute/field of a PowerPlatform entity

tools.name: get-entity-relationships
tools.description: Get relationships (one-to-many and many-to-many) for a PowerPlatform entity

tools.name: get-global-option-set
tools.description: Get a global option set definition by name

tools.name: get-record
tools.description: Get a specific record by entity name (plural) and ID

tools.name: query-records
tools.description: Query records using an OData filter expression

tools.name: use-powerplatform-prompt
tools.description: Use a predefined prompt template for PowerPlatform entities

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@michsob/powerplatform-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
